revised_title: Infection and Transmission of Trypanosoma gambiense in Antelopes
tldr: The authors investigate the infection and transmission of Trypanosoma gambiense in antelopes, finding that waterbuck, bushbuck, and reedbuck can be readily infected with a human strain of the parasite, and that laboratory-bred Glossina palpalis can transmit the virus from infected antelopes to susceptible animals.
